channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: At 45, Venus Williams will be the oldest player in the U.S. Open in decades
item.description: With a wild card invitation, the tennis legend is making history in her return to the U.S. Open later this month as the oldest singles player to take the court in more than 40 years.
item.content:encoded:
With a wild card invitation, the tennis legend is making history in her return to the U.S. Open later this month as the oldest singles player to take the court in more than 40 years.

(Image credit: Scott Taetsch)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Four Years after Taliban's Return to Power in Afghanistan, Life for Many has Worsened
item.description: It's been four years since the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan and the Taliban's return to power. Life for certain groups has deteriorated significantly. But the Trump administration says Afghanistan’s conditions have improved in recent years to the point where sending Afghan nationals BACK does not pose a threat to their safety.
item.content:encoded: It's been four years since the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan and the Taliban's return to power. Life for certain groups has deteriorated significantly. But the Trump administration says Afghanistan’s conditions have improved in recent years to the point where sending Afghan nationals BACK does not pose a threat to their safety.
item.dc:creator: Arezou Rezvani

item.title: This virus seems like it's no longer a problem. It's still a threat
item.description: A year ago, on Aug. 14, 2024, the World Health Organization declared mpox a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. Why are health experts so frustrated by the world's response?
item.content:encoded:
A year ago, on Aug. 14, 2024, the World Health Organization declared mpox a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. Why are health experts so frustrated by the world's response?

(Image credit: Glody Murhabazi)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: D.C. clergy slam federal takeover: 'Fear is not a strategy for safety'
item.description: A group of religious leaders in Washington, D.C. is criticizing President Donald Trump's federal takeover of the District's police force, saying his rhetoric is dehumanizing and counterproductive.
item.content:encoded:
A group of religious leaders in Washington, D.C. is criticizing President Donald Trump's federal takeover of the District's police force, saying his rhetoric is dehumanizing and counterproductive.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: Failed New Mexico candidate gets 80 years in shootings at rivals' homes
item.description: A jury convicted former Republican candidate Solomon Peña of conspiracy, weapons and other charges in the shootings in 2022 and 2023 on the homes of four Democratic officials in Albuquerque, including the current state House speaker.
item.content:encoded:
A jury convicted former Republican candidate Solomon Peña of conspiracy, weapons and other charges in the shootings in 2022 and 2023 on the homes of four Democratic officials in Albuquerque, including the current state House speaker.

(Image credit: Roberto E. Rosales/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump and Putin have history. That adds to the intrigue for Anchorage summit
item.description: President Trump says he'll know "probably in the first two minutes" whether Vladimir Putin is serious about ending the war in Ukraine, touting his past relationship with the Russian leader.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he'll know "probably in the first two minutes" whether Vladimir Putin is serious about ending the war in Ukraine, touting his past relationship with the Russian leader.

(Image credit: Mikhail Klimentyev)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Supreme Court allows Mississippi social media law to go into effect
item.description: The law requires all users to verify their ages before using common social media sites ranging from Facebook to Nextdoor.
item.content:encoded:
The law requires all users to verify their ages before using common social media sites ranging from Facebook to Nextdoor.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Anti-Trump podcast MeidasTouch is rivaling Joe Rogan. Does it have staying power?
item.description: The left-leaning media outfit has surged in Donald Trump's second term, appealing to progressives outraged by the president. Still, the online streaming world remains dominated by right-wing voices.
item.content:encoded: The left-leaning media outfit has surged in Donald Trump's second term, appealing to progressives outraged by the president. Still, the online streaming world remains dominated by right-wing voices.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Takeaways from Taylor Swift's podcast appearance: her new album, romance and more
item.description: Swift revealed the release date, cover art and track list for The Life of a Showgirl. She also discussed her romance with Travis Kelce, buying back her masters and recovering from the Eras Tour.
item.content:encoded:
New Heights, the podcast he cohosts with his brother Jason Kelce.'/>

Swift revealed the release date, cover art and track list for The Life of a Showgirl. She also discussed her romance with Travis Kelce, buying back her masters and recovering from the Eras Tour.

(Image credit: New Heights)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Mayors of Democratic cities beyond D.C. decry Trump's takeover threats
item.description: When Trump announced his law enforcement actions in D.C., he also singled out a slew of other Democratic cities. The mayors of Baltimore, LA, Chicago, New York and Oakland, Calif., say crime is down.
item.content:encoded: When Trump announced his law enforcement actions in D.C., he also singled out a slew of other Democratic cities. The mayors of Baltimore, LA, Chicago, New York and Oakland, Calif., say crime is down.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
